pageContent.instructions: <welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:11pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:bold; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">What is your next step?</welcomeText >

choice.choiceText: A. Ask Dr. Gomez what treatments tend to contribute to low patient satisfaction. Based on her answer, help her explore the factors that may be contributing to the low satisfaction.
B. Ask Dr. Gomez how she feels that you, as a pharma rep, can best help her and the other cardiologists help the patients, thereby positively impact patient satisfaction.
C. Refer Dr. Gomez to Dr. Rivers, Nephrologist, your champion within Maycomb. It is possible that he has perspective on how to improve satisfaction in patients with hyponatremia.

D. Share with Dr. Gomez the different factors that affect patient satisfaction. Discuss how being aware of all the treatment options for dilutional hyponatremia, and the ability to select the best option for each individual patient, may increase patient satisfaction. Offer to provide education on our treatment option for dilutional hyponatremia.

pageContent.summary: <welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:12pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:normal; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">The best way to help Dr. Gomez increase patient satisfaction is to talk to her about the factors that impact patient satisfaction, and to offer education on our treatment option for dilutional hyponatremia. Her ability to select the best option for each individual patient may increase patient satisfaction (Choice D). Choice A is too general, and while it may initiate an interesting discussion, it would have little value. Choice B is not effective because you are not coming to the table with a point of view and a recommendation for a solution. Choice C may be effective, but again, it is too general and does not demonstrate your understanding of the cardiology department. Discussing the factors that contribute to patient satisfaction, and offering education on our treatment option for treating dilutional hyponatremia, positions you as a trusted advisor who can address a specific concern.</welcomeText>
